data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3160331,"name":"k.gill","username":"karin.gill123","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f07891/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-08T21:25:58.140Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe have a mister and are trying to figure out how to connect it to the actual Omio controller.  Or do we need to?  We can’t find any good documentation.  It seems if we just plug it in and let it run, it will run, but not shut off when the part is done.  It seems it should be controlled by the Omio machine.\u003cbr\u003e\nIf anyone could let us know how the mister is controlled and hooked up electrically, we would really appreciate it!\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2023-03-08T21:25:58.140Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":27,"reads":88,"readers_count":87,"score":152.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":429448,"topic_slug":"omio-x8-how-do-you-connect-a-mister-to-the-actual-machine-or-do-you","display_username":"k.gill","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27413,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/omio-x8-how-do-you-connect-a-mister-to-the-actual-machine-or-do-you/429448/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3160338,"name":"Jeff Jensen","username":"mobius911","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f08c70/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-08T21:34:30.136Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eYou have it right- although normally they are fed from a compressor, and a quarter-turn valve on the line to the mister is used to start and stop it. Is yours using compressed air? I’m sure there is some way to get it to start and stop with the part run using programming, but I think everyone just starts and stops the mister manually.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWe fabricated a bracket to hold ours that ties into the router mount. Many misters come with a magnetic base, but it usually isn’t very stable. Fabricating a bracket mount is the way to go.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2023-03-08T21:34:30.136Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":75,"readers_count":74,"score":15.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":429448,"topic_slug":"omio-x8-how-do-you-connect-a-mister-to-the-actual-machine-or-do-you","display_username":"Jeff Jensen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29120,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/omio-x8-how-do-you-connect-a-mister-to-the-actual-machine-or-do-you/429448/2","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3327214,"name":"system","username":"system","avatar_template":"/uploads/default/original/4X/9/3/2/93234578e69f55873c63fc00fe2d0d85f23bce55.png","created_at":"2024-03-07T21:35:08.313Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThis topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply.
